article.title: Theoretical studies on structural and decay properties of $Z=119$ superheavy nuclei

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 primarily illustrate about the Z=119 isotopic chain as a function of mass number?
choices: A sharp decrease in two-neutron separation energy indicating a neutron magic number.
A sudden change in radii signifying shape transitions within the isotopic chain.
A consistent oblate deformation parameter (Î²2) throughout the mass range.
A lack of agreement between RMF and FRDM calculated binding energies.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which type of radii shows a significant increase around mass number 298 in the Z=119 isotopic chain, as shown in Figure 2?
What type of nucleon density distribution does Figure 3 suggest for the spherical configuration of 291119 and 303119?
choices: Central depletion with a peak at the surface.
Central peak with gradual decrease towards the surface.
Highly dense central region with a thin outer layer.

multiple_choice_question.text: What structural feature is observed in the two-dimensional contour plots of 291119 and 303119, particularly in prolate and oblate configurations, as shown in Figure 4?
choices: A large central void indicating a bubble nucleus.
Distinct clusters of nucleons far from the center.
A lack of density variation across the nucleus.
